newsitem.title: USA: Structural Dynamics sees $25 mln Q1 charge.
newsitem.headline: Structural Dynamics sees $25 mln Q1 charge.

text.p: Structural Dynmaics Research Corp said on Monday it expected to take a $25 million one-time charge in its first quarter 1997, for its acquisition of Metaphase from Control Data Systems Inc.
The company said it would take the charge mostly for the write off of in-process research and development.
Earlier, Control Data and it reached an agreement under which Structural Dynamics would acquire Control Data's 50 percent stake in their Metaphase joint venture.
The deal, valued at $31 million, consisted of cash and a warrant to buy Structural Dynamics stock, the company said.
The company said it estimated earnings per share dilution from operations would be about $0.10 per share in 1997, but that the acquisition would benefit earnings in 1998.

Upon completion of the deal, Metaphase would be a wholly-owned subsidiary of Structural Dynamics, the company said. Structural Dynamics said the acquisition would expand is product data management market opportunities.
